column5: It was very cold this morning.  I was on the water by 6 am and was off by 10  this morning.  It seemed to get colder and as you can see I was ill prepared wearing shorts and flip flops.  i decide to try something new and was pleased with the results.  I managed 12 smallmouth in time I was out there and lost 3 others.  The bass are starting to get really fat.  I think they are already in their fall feeding period. Despite the cold it was a great morning on Simcoe. Enjoy the pics
Nice Picts Cudz, wish I was there with ya
nice report cudz....looks like a great day on the water
Those are some nice, fat smallies.  Great work
Nice shootin there on those Simcoe smallies.  Who took the pictures?
Great report and pics Cudz  Good job on those fat slabs! Thanks for sharing Leechman
great smallies!  thanks for the report!

Sweet bass!  Great pics and nice fish for sure.  When I got up at 530 this morning it was 14C according to the radio.  When I got to the office at 715, they said the temps went down to 12C, so it wasn't your imagination...it did get colder!
Nice pics and some good lookin' Smallies!!!  ... so what was the "something new"?   *GCD snickers at cold*
Those snickers will become shivers in mid-september. Pack for four seasons, that'll get you through 'til lunch! -Brian
Very impressive. Seeing that it was cold and windy that morning!! Some really nice smallies there. Thanks for sharing.
